traditional_questions.question: Tell me about yourself
variations: Can you introduce yourself to us?
answer_structure: Talk about who you are professionally
Talk about why you are here
traditional_questions.tips: Summarize CV, not download it. 5-7 liners. Be chronological. Emphasize achievements subtly.

traditional_questions.question: What do you know about our company?
traditional_questions.tips: Visit company website. Read history, mission, products, management. Check latest news. Know core values.

traditional_questions.question: Why do you want to work for us?
traditional_questions.tips: Give 3 reasons. Show research. Align with company goals.

traditional_questions.question: What are your strengths?
traditional_questions.tips: Choose strengths relevant to position. Stay away from personal qualities, concentrate on professional traits.

bank_specific_questions.question: Introduce yourself, please?
bank_specific_questions.tips: Summarize CV: Name, age, education, qualification, professional achievements, experience

bank_specific_questions.question: Is there anything not on CV we must know?
bank_specific_questions.tips: Mention rewards, contests, prizes, volunteer projects, exchange student experience, scholarships

bank_specific_questions.question: Why do you want to work in the banking industry?
bank_specific_questions.warning: Never say you're looking into any possible industry because you've been unemployed

bank_specific_questions.question: Tell us about your last mistake and what you have learned from it?
bank_specific_questions.tips: Show ability to avoid conflicts, willingness to find compromise

bank_specific_questions.question: Fraud Scenario
bank_specific_questions.text: Let's say you got a new job and found a fraud in your department. However, your predecessor is now your boss. What would you do?

bank_specific_questions.question: How important is customer service to you?
follow_ups: Have you ever worked with a difficult client?
How do you handle such situations?

bank_specific_questions.question: How many houses are in Lagos?
bank_specific_questions.purpose: Tests handling of difficult tasks, thought process

tough_questions.question: What is your greatest weakness?
bad_answers: I tend to fold under pressure
tough_questions.suggested_answer: My writing skills are quite impressive but I've been working towards doing more in a short period of time and producing quality work even under pressure. I'm taking conscious steps to ensure I curb my weakness of underperforming in a high-pressure situation

tough_questions.question: Why should we hire you?
bad_answers: I'm passionate about what I do
I'd be of value to your organization
tough_questions.suggested_answer: In my current (previous) role as a marketing manager, I have been successful in generating 70% of the company's leads which had a 50% conversion rate. Seeing that your company is also customer-centric, it has always been part of my job and personal passion to ensure that decisions are made with the customer in mind. These are the kind of results and performance I'm bringing to the table.

tough_questions.question: Why are you leaving your current company?
tough_questions.suggested_answer: While I highly valued my time at my previous company, there are no longer learning opportunities or career growth opportunities. Being at the company was a huge learning curve for me but I am seeking new challenges and opportunities that align with my personal career goals and aspirations.

tough_questions.question: How well do you work under pressure?
bad_answers: I would say I work well under pressure
I can't work well under pressure
tough_questions.suggested_answer: Honestly, I'm someone who thrives under pressure. It's not always easy but it must be done. I have grown the habit of being proactive, so as to avoid any situation that will put me under pressure in the first place. The key to thriving is really planning and time management - both are skills I have up my sleeve.

tough_questions.question: How much do you currently earn?
tough_questions.suggested_answer: Well, I have a very robust job description and even go the extra mile to execute tasks outside my JD. I currently earn somewhere between N150,000 - N250,000, this is subject to further increase scheduled by the company

tough_questions.question: What is your salary expectation?
bad_answers: I expect nothing less that N250,000
I'm looking at receiving N250,000 net
tough_questions.suggested_answer: Considering the job description and working conditions, I am looking at anywhere between N250,000 to N350,000 monthly. I'm more than open to negotiating this, depending upon your benefits package.

tough_questions.question: Why have you been out of work? / Can you explain the gaps in your employment history?
tough_questions.suggested_answer: I have been out of work before due to several factors like the company getting sold, change of location, as well as health crisis. But during each gap, I took time to improve my skills, gain additional knowledge and really take time out to assess my career trajectory.

pressure_questions.question: Why is your CGPA low?
variations: Your grades are not so strong. Why is that?
You graduated with a 2.2. Can you explain?
Tell me about your academic performance
pressure_questions.context: Very common in Nigerian interviews. CGPA matters significantly.

pressure_questions.question: Why haven't you gotten a job since graduation?
Are you planning to relocate?
variations: Do you have plans to travel?
Will you stay long with us?
How long do you plan to stay?
pressure_questions.context: Japa (emigration) probe - major concern for Nigerian employers
